Veteran BBC reporter Alan Johnston was handed over to Hamas leaders in Gaza early Wednesday by his captors, the Army of Islam, an Islamist group backed by a powerful Gaza clan, the Daghmoush family.
Today, in Jerusalem, looking tired and relieved, Johnston stood in the sunshine he was deprived of during his three months of solitary confinement in a dingy Gaza apartment.
It was - as you can imagine - the most appalling experience like being buried alive, removed from life.

The BBC reporter, who turned 45 years old in captivity, said he was not physically tortured and was roughed up only in the last hours of his confinement.
